entry.title: RISE
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 60.00 - 95.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

Finca El Platanar y Anexos is a family company whose members are fully committed to producing coffee of the highest quality and excellence, seeking a balance between productivity and sustainability of the environment in which it is grown. Its Owners are constantly seeking new technologies and farming techniques that benefit the productivity of plantations, without losing sight of the organoleptic characteristics of the harvested grains.

All harvested coffee at Finca El Platanar y Anexos, involves a well-defined ripe fruit selection, making at the end of the day a thorough cleaning, to avoid sending immature cherries to the wet milling process.

CypherED Profile

Caramelized hazelnut, lemon tart, round & velvety mouthfeel, long chocolate aftertaste

Facts

Origin: Guatemala

Region: Acatenango

Farm: Finca El Platanar y Anexos

Altitude: 1,600 - 1,900 m

Varietal: Catuai, Caturra

Process: Washed

Type: Single Origin

entry.title: MIEL
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastary
Type: Coffee
Price: 60.00 - 95.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

El Salvador is known for having volcanos all over the country. The landscape has benefitted them in many ways, especially with its rich volcanic soils. Finca Loma de Paja happened to be on the hills of El Salvador's tallest volcano, that is the Ilamatepec Volano also known as the “Volcan de Santa Ana” which made its last eruption in 2005. The growing land range in altitudes from 1200MASL meters to 1850MASL meters. With it is rich in volcanic soil and the ideal varietals they are able to produce some of their country’s top-quality coffee.

CYPHERED PROFILE

Chocolate, hazelnut, piquant acidity, smooth velvety mouthfeel, long sweet aftertaste

Facts

Origin: El Salvador

Region: Santa Ana, Ilamatepec Volcano

Altitude: 1,250 m

Varietal: Red Bourbon

Process: Honey

entry.title: DIEGO SAMUEL VILLA ROSITA
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastary
Type: Coffee
Price: 135.00 - 260.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

Diego Samuel started with his coffee growing project in Finca El Paraiso in 2008. To him growing coffee was fascinating, he loved visiting his friend’s farms and see them growing coffee. His family owned a farm that was isolated so Diego saw the opportunity to grow coffee there. He began his project by utilizing 2.5 hectares of land. The coffee that was harvested was sold to local coffee cooperatives and that money helped finance his studies in Agricultural Enterprise Management.

Meanwhile, he started building a network of fair and transparent coffee buyers. Luckily we were one of the first roasters that cupped and bought this coffee.

 

CypherED Profile

Intense floral aroma, cherry, peach, juicy mouthfeel, hibiscus tea finish.

Facts

Origin: Colombia

Region: Cauca

Producer: Diego Samuel Bermudez

Altitude: 1,920 m

Varietal: Castillo

Process: Natural

entry.title: Tabi Elegante
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastary
Type: Coffee
Price: 65.00 - 105.00 (2 variants)

FARM HISTORY

Their journey with specialty coffee production in 2002 with the Tabi Indio. Next was Java as they attempted to produce some rare and exotic varietals hard to find in Colombia. They planted Java, Tabi Co., and Geisha in mid-2015 and started the first cherry-picking in March-April of 2017. Later, they started trying different fermentation and drying processes including naturals, honey, and semi-washed. Today they have an array of specialty coffees with great notes to indulge your senses.

CypherED Profile

Jasmine, Candied apple, stone fruits, smooth and silky, sweet vanilla finish

Facts

Origin: Colombia

Region: Trujillo, Valle del Cauca

Altitude: 1,650 - 1,700 m

Varietal: Tabi-Indo

Process: Semi-Washed

entry.title: Santa Gertrudis Caturra Natural
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 75.00 - 125.00 (2 variants)

FARM history

Hacienda Santa Gertrudis neighbours Podocarpus National Park and is only minutes away from Vilcabamba, a town famous internationally for its pleasant climate and the longevity of its inhabitants.

At 1,600m – 1,700 high, the farm cultivates several varietals of Arabica coffee such as Caturra, Yellow Catuaí, Geisha, Sidra, SL28, Typica and Bourbon.

In 1954, Luis Emilio Eguiguren planted the first coffee trees on the farm and then started selling his beans in surrounding markets. Since then, he introduced innovations to improve the quality of his coffee and post-harvest processing, both of which made him worthy of recognition by the industry. Six decades later, the farm’s curiosity still drives the constant quest for excellence in the cup.

CypherED Profile

Stone fruits, cinnamon, caramel, cacao nibs, round silky body, chocolate fudge aftertaste.

Facts

Origin: Ecuador

Region: Loja Province

Farm: Hacienda Santa Gertrudis

Altitude: 1,600 - 1,700 m

Varietal: Caturra

Process: Natural

entry.title: Porlex Mini Grinder II
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Gadgets
Price: 368.00

With its newly designed burr set, the Porlex II can grind beans easier, faster, and more evenly. This results in less fines, less boulders, and more even grounds. Do you know what they say about even grounds? More delicious coffee in your mouth! Compared to the Porlex I, this grinder can produce roughly 1.3 times more coffee with the same number of rotations. Wow! There is no need to worry about the top of the grinder rolling away like a boulder in Indiana Jones - Porlex has redesigned the adjustment nut so that it stands up proud and tall on its own! With the new burr, the per-click adjustment changes an average of 37 microns - meaning you can further dial in your Hario V60 recipe. Made in Japan with higher quality materials than its predecessor, the Porlex II punches above its weight - scaring its rivals back to their grinder travel pouch caves.

Moka Express is the most classic model made by Bialetti, the world's leading manufacturer of coffee makers. This is the coffee pot that made the Italian manufacturer famous in the 1930s. To this day it is the most popular Moka model in the world, as more than 200 million pots have been produced so far.

entry.title: Chemex Bundle
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Bundle > Chemex
Price: 285.00

Known as a pristine coffee maker, Chemex employs all of the chemically correct methods for brewing.  It's hourglass shaped flask is made entirely of glass, a chemically inert material that does not absorb odors or chemical residues. The Chemex has no moving parts and will work forever, unless it is dropped or in some other way demolished. Chemex filters are made of the highest quality filter paper.

Bundle Includes

Chemex (6-cup)

Chemex paper filters

One 250g coffee bags of your choice

 

Check out our Chemex brewing guides for more information.

entry.title: PANAMA GEISHA - WASHED
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Coffee
Price: 110.50

FARM history

Finca Lerida’s reputation is as old as the first coffee that Panama exported to Germany back in 1929. The high quality coffee produced inside this exceptional plantation made its international buyers realize that there was more to Panama than just it’s famous Canal. This was, and still is, Finca Lerida.

 

Panama Lerida Estate is one of the oldest coffee farms in Panama, founded by Toleff Boche Monniche in the 1920s. The family farm was sold to the Collins family in 1957. The Collins family, and particularly John Collins, were instrumental in changing the worldwide perception of coffee in Panama. In early Best of Panama competitions in the early 2000s, the Lerida Estate set the standard for what coffee in Panama can taste like. This was even before the famous Geisha variety was found in Panama.

Finca Lerida then was separated by lots, understanding the differences created by the microclimates and conditions within the farm.

Esplendorosa Estate was planted with Geisha due to its high altitude and great conditions for Geisha development. Its size made it Geisha heaven and has won many prizes in the Best Of Panama competition.

Almost 100 years since it started exporting coffee, Finca Lerida still maintains the trademarked quality that made it among Panama’s most famous names in the world of coffee. 

CypherED Profile

Intense floral, jasmine aroma, delicate acidity, creamy body, long aftertaste of berries & bergamot-like notes

Facts

Origin: Panama

Region: Boquete, Chiriquí

Farm: Esplendorosa Estate

Altitude: 1,600 - 1,800 m

Varietal: Geisha

Process: Washed

 

Weight: 200g

Roast: Omni Roast

entry.title: Melitta Purista
entry.summary:
Vendor: Cypher Roastery
Type: Gadgets
Price: 2000.00

Purista Series 300

Pure coffee enjoyment.

As the name suggests, Purista has only one mission: to make coffee that does what coffee has to do – taste really good! The Purista is one of the narrowest fully automatic coffee machines in the world. A modern front panel, large, integrated buttons and a large rotary switch ensure easy handling. The newly designed drip tray has a stainless steel drip plate with an integrated high-quality anti-scratch plastic insert.
